pages.text: At times, the situation may arise where two modifiers both have desirable traits, but only one slot is available. Through the process of $(2)Modifier Composition$(), these modifiers may be joined into a single modifier that takes on traits from both components. Note that this is not a constructive process: the resultant modifier will have a magnitude equal to the average of the two components' magnitudes.

pages.title: Composition Specifics
pages.text: More specifically, composing two modifiers produces a result modifier for the vector sum of the two component modifiers, but with the length of the average component magnitude. Thus, composing near-orthogonal modifiers will incur a significant loss.
